name: Version
description: The AWS::Lambda::Version resource publishes a specified version of an AWS Lambda (Lambda) function. When publishing a new version of your function, Lambda copies the latest version of your function. For more information, see Introduction to AWS Lambda Versioning in the AWS Lambda Developer Guide.

properties.name: CodeSha256
properties.description: The SHA-256 hash of the deployment package that you want to publish. This value must match the SHA-256 hash of the $LATEST version of the function. Specify this property to validate that you are publishing the correct package.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: A description of the version you are publishing. If you don't specify a value, Lambda copies the description from the $LATEST version of the function.

properties.name: FunctionName
properties.description: The Lambda function for which you want to publish a version. You can specify the function's name or its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

attributes.name: Version
attributes.description: The published version of a Lambda version, such as 1.
